comments.body: I'm just trying to be consistent with the rest of the file, where optional parameters are specified in this style.
the one you have allows something like `sequence("name", ()=>{}, ()=> {})` which the API does not handle.

True, as does the `attr()` declaration on line 92 (not sure if there are other examples). However, simply adding the two lines as you have would mean only the top one gets the documentation associated with it (at least in VS Code's tooltips). Rather than that, or duplicating the documentation, I have chosen to follow the same choice made elsewhere in this file.

I feel that duplicating the documentation is a better choice here, as the overload style @mhegazy suggested is both more accurate and conveys intent more clearly. However since your addition matches the existing declarations, I'll merge this. I'll still encourage you to submit another PR that changes this and the existing declarations to overloads. Thank you!
